decks.notes: This deck focuses on using aggressive creatures like Slimefoot and Squee along with powerful spells to overwhelm the opponent in a one-on-one Duel Commander format. The creatures in the deck provide early board presence and resilience, while the spells offer disruption and removal to control the game. The mana base is optimized to support the deck's aggressive strategy, with a mix of lands that provide different colors and utility. Overall, the deck aims to quickly establish a threatening board presence and apply pressure to the opponent, forcing them to react to the relentless onslaught of creatures and spells.

The focus of this deck is to utilize a wide variety of control spells and disruption to manipulate the game in your favor. With Eris, Roar of the Storm as the commander, the deck includes a mix of counter spells, removal, card draw, and cantrips to maintain control of the battlefield and outmaneuver your opponent. The goal is to disrupt your opponent's strategy, protect your own game plan, and ultimately win through incremental advantage and resource management. By carefully timing spells and utilizing Eris's abilities effectively, you can stay one step ahead of your opponent and dictate the pace of the game until you secure victory.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game through a combination of counter spells, removal, and card advantage. By utilizing Ertai Resurrected as the commander, the deck aims to control the board and disrupt the opponent's strategy while slowly building up its own resources. The deck includes a variety of counterspells, removal spells, and card draw engines to maintain control of the game. Additionally, it includes powerful creatures like Baleful Strix and Sheoldred, the Apocalypse to apply pressure on the opponent while still holding up counterspells. The mana base is well-tuned to ensure consistency and flexibility in casting spells. Ultimately, the goal is to outvalue the opponent and win through incremental advantage.

The deck is focused on controlling the game through a combination of counterspells, removal, and card advantage. Tivit, Seller of Secrets is the commander that allows the player to draw extra cards and manipulate the top of their library. The deck includes a wide range of control elements such as Counterspell, Force of Will, and Cryptic Command to disrupt the opponent's plans. It also includes removal spells like Fatal Push and Swords to Plowshares to deal with threats on the board. Card advantage is gained through cards like Brainstorm, Teferi, Hero of Dominaria, and Snapcaster Mage. The goal is to outvalue the opponent while keeping the board under control to eventually win the game.

This deck focuses on overwhelming the opponent with a combination of control spells, counterspells, removal, and powerful planeswalkers. Atraxa, Grand Unifier serves as the commander, providing additional value and flexibility. The deck includes a variety of mana fixing lands and ramps to ensure consistent access to the necessary colors. By disrupting the opponent's strategy and managing the board effectively, the deck aims to outlast the opponent and win through incremental advantage. With a mix of efficient removal spells, card advantage engines, and powerful finishers like Emrakul, the Promised End, this deck is designed to control the game's pace and ultimately come out on top in the 1 vs 1 Duel Commander format.

The main concept of this deck is to establish control of the game through the use of land ramp, card advantage, and powerful threats. Azusa, Lost But Seeking allows for explosive starts by playing multiple additional lands each turn, accelerating the deck's game plan. The deck includes a variety of land-based ramp spells and creatures to quickly develop a strong mana base. It also includes powerful control elements such as board wipes, removal spells, and utility lands to disrupt the opponent's strategy. The end goal is to overwhelm the opponent with powerful creatures like Primeval Titan, Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger, and Wurmcoil Engine while maintaining control of the battlefield.
